One-click cleanup of all invisible elements

Bulk icon flattening for consistent results

126847.release_notes:
Key Features (Excerpt for Release Notes)
Dynamic Word Count Matching: "Smart Lorem Ipsum" counts the number of words in each text layer within a frame (excluding punctuation) and generates Lorem Ipsum text with the exact same word count. plugins.name: Google Sheets & EasyContent Sync
plugins.description:
Tired of using ‚ÄúLorem Ipsum‚Äù and generic images and then realizing that the text doesn‚Äôt fit or the image aspect ratio is different? Why not use your REAL content?


NEW: Introduced free Figma - Google Sheets integration


Watch the overview video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uuEsBKcnNp8


Say goodbye to placeholder text and Lorem Ipsum! The EasyContent plugin bridges the gap between your content and your design team by bringing your actual website content directly into Figma. Enhance your workflow, improve collaboration, and create designs that truly reflect the final product.


Why Use the EasyContent Plugin?

Designing with fake content can lead to broken experiences and costly revisions. With EasyContent, you can:

  1. Enhance Collaboration: Align your design and content teams by working with real content.
  2. Improve UX: Stress-test your designs with actual content to ensure they work in all scenarios.
  3. Impress Stakeholders: Present realistic mockups that accurately reflect the final product.


Key Features

  1. Direct Integration with EasyContent.io: Securely connect your EasyContent projects to Figma.
  2. Drag and Drop Content Fields: Easily insert text and images from your content projects into your designs.
  3. Content Swapping: Swap between different content items to test layouts and stress-test designs.
  4. Real-Time Updates: Keep your designs up-to-date with the latest content from your projects.
  5. Support for Text and Images: Currently supports single-line text, multi-line text, rich text, and images.


Who Is This Plugin For?

  1. Marketing and Web Design Agencies: Streamline your workflow by integrating content and design tools.
  2. Design Teams: Collaborate effectively with content creators and ensure designs are content-ready.
  3. Content Creators: Visualize how content will appear in the final design and provide feedback.


Getting Started

  1. Install the Plugin: Download the EasyContent plugin from the Figma Marketplace.
  2. Connect Your Account: Enter your EasyContent API key to securely connect your projects. If you don‚Äôt have an account, create it here: https://easycontent.io/
  3. Select a Project and Template: Choose the content you want to work with.
  4. Drag and Drop Content: Insert content fields directly into your design.


Future Developments

We're continuously improving the EasyContent plugin. Upcoming features include support for additional content types like checkboxes, radio buttons, selects, and dates.


Need Help or Have Suggestions?

We're here to support you. If you have any questions or feedback, please contact us at support@easycontent.io.


Transform Your Design Process Today

Elevate your designs by integrating real content directly from EasyContent. Install the EasyContent plugin now and experience a more efficient, collaborative, and realistic design process!
plugins.tagline: Design with real content, not placeholders. Bridge the gap between your content and design teams!

plugins.name: Color Mate by UX mate
plugins.description:
Color Mate by UX Mate: Your Color Assistant in Figma


Struggling to create harmonious color palettes? Color Mate is here to be your color confidante in Figma! This user-friendly plugin takes the guesswork out of color selection, allowing you to generate beautiful and cohesive palettes based on a single chosen color.


Here's how Color Mate streamlines your design workflow:


Pick Your Perfect Base: Select any color that sparks your design inspiration ‚Äì it can be from your existing design or a new hue you've discovered.

Explore a Spectrum of Styles: Choose from various color scheme types like Monochromatic, Contrast, Triadic, and more, each offering a unique color harmony.

Fine-Tune Your Palette: Customize the palette by selecting variations like Pastel, Soft, Light, Hard, Pale, and others ‚Äì find the perfect balance for your design needs.

Generate Endless Possibilities: Need more palette options? No problem! Color Mate allows you to generate as many palettes as you desire until you find the perfect fit.

Seamless Integration: Once you're happy with your chosen palette, effortlessly create Figma Color Styles directly from the generated colors. This ensures consistent use of your chosen color scheme throughout your design.


With Color Mate, you can:


Save valuable design time: Stop wasting precious minutes mixing and matching colors ‚Äì Color Mate generates ready-to-use palettes in seconds.

Experiment with confidence: Explore diverse color harmonies without worrying about clashing colors.

Achieve design consistency: Create cohesive color schemes with ease thanks to Figma Style generation.

Color Mate by UX Mate ‚Äì Your key to effortless and beautiful color palettes in Figma!

plugins.name: MotionPoint Translator
plugins.description:
Overview

Unlock the full potential of your Figma designs with our state-of-the-art plugin. Designed for seamless integration, this tool brings professional translation services into your Figma workflow, automating the creation of translated versions of your designs.


Seamless Integration

Bridge the gap between design and global communication by automating the generation of translated Figma designs. Our plugin ensures your UI/UX resonates with audiences worldwide, offering both human and machine translation options.


Simple Steps to Localization

Language Selection: Start by choosing the languages you want to translate your design into, ensuring a wide-reaching impact.

Translation Quality: Select the desired level of translation quality‚Äîopt for Human Translation for nuanced accuracy or Machine Translation for swift turnaround.

Translation Progress: Monitor the translation's progress with ease. Our plugin keeps you updated every step of the way.

Import Translations: Once translations are complete, import them directly from the Progress tab or use the Import tab to generate the translated designs for all selected languages


Effortless Process

With minimal effort, watch as your Figma projects elevate to an international standard. Our plugin simplifies the complexities of localization, letting you focus on what you do best: creating stunning, culturally resonant designs.

plugins.name: Export to WebP
plugins.description:
Export to WebP transforms your Figma frames into optimised WebP images with just a few clicks.


WebP offers significantly smaller file sizes compared to PNG while maintaining excellent visual quality - perfect for web projects where performance matters.


Key Features


Smart Target File Size Optimisation ‚ú® NEW

‚Ä¢Set your desired file size (e.g., "100 KB" or "2 MB") and let the plugin automatically find the perfect quality setting

‚Ä¢Advanced binary search algorithm optimises quality to hit your exact target size

‚Ä¢Real-time progress feedback shows optimisation iterations

‚Ä¢Perfect for meeting specific file size requirements or bandwidth constraints

‚†Ä

Advanced Transparency Control ‚ú® NEW

‚Ä¢Preserve or remove alpha channel (transparency) based on your needs

‚Ä¢Keep transparent backgrounds for overlays and UI elements

‚Ä¢Remove transparency for smaller file sizes when opacity isn't needed

‚Ä¢Smart default settings optimize for most common use cases


Efficient WebP Conversion

‚Ä¢Convert any Figma element to WebP format with high-quality results

‚Ä¢Save up to 30-75% in file size compared to PNG format

‚Ä¢Maintain visual quality while dramatically reducing file sizes


Flexible Quality Settings

‚Ä¢Choose from preset quality options (High Quality, Web Optimised, Ultra Compressed)

‚Ä¢Fine-tune compression with a precise quality slider (0-100%)

‚Ä¢Create and save custom quality presets for your specific needs


Batch Processing

‚Ä¢Convert multiple elements simultaneously

‚Ä¢Real-time progress tracking with accurate completion estimates

‚Ä¢Optimised memory usage for handling large selections


Export Options

‚Ä¢Save as a single ZIP file containing all WebP images

‚Ä¢Download individual WebP files directly

‚Ä¢Automatic naming based on your Figma layer structure


Detailed Statistics

‚Ä¢View before/after file size comparisons

‚Ä¢See exact file size savings for each conversion

‚Ä¢Track total compression savings across your selection


Simple Workflow

‚Ä¢Select elements ‚Üí Choose quality ‚Üí Convert ‚Üí Download

‚Ä¢Integrates seamlessly with your Figma workflow

‚Ä¢Works with frames, components, groups, shapes, text, and more


Performance Optimised

‚Ä¢Fast conversions even for high-resolution graphics

‚Ä¢Memory-efficient processing for large batches


Please leave some feedback if you find this plugin useful :)
plugins.tagline: Convert your designs to WebP - smaller files, same quality

plugins.name: Export local variables to Json
plugins.description:
Plugin Overview

This plugin takes Local Variables of Figma and outputs them as a JSON file in Style Dictionary format. This allows design tokens to be efficiently reflected in the code.


Main Functions

1. Get Local Variables

- Color values

- Spacing

- Typography

and other variables are automatically retrieved


2. Maintain hierarchical structure

// Maintain Figma structure (e.g.colors/primary/base) in JSON format
{
"colors": {
"primary": {
"base": {
"$value": "#1a2b3c",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}


3. Value Conversion

- Colors: Convert from RGBA to HEX format

- Numbers: Manage decimal precision

- Variable references: Properly resolve aliases


How to Use

1. Launch the plugin in Figma

2. Click the "Export" button

3. Download the generated JSON file


Features

- JSON output compliant with Style Dictionary format

- Simple UI

- Error fallback handling

- Comprehensive validation


Applications

- Design system construction

- Batch management of design tokens

- Synchronization with codebase


This plugin enables seamless bridging between design and code.
plugins.tagline: you can export all local variables as json

"colors": {
"primary": {
"base": {
"$value": "#1a2b3c",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}


3. Value Conversion

- Colors: Convert from RGBA to HEX format

- Numbers: Manage decimal precision

- Variable references: Properly resolve aliases


How to Use

1. Launch the plugin in Figma

2. Click the "Export" button

3. Download the generated JSON file


Features

- JSON output compliant with Style Dictionary format

- Simple UI

- Error fallback handling

- Comprehensive validation


Applications

- Design system construction

- Batch management of design tokens

- Synchronization with codebase


This plugin enables seamless bridging between design and code.
124722.tagline: you can export all local variables as json

plugins.name: Huima
plugins.description:
Huima


Translate designs into development-ready code at lightning speed


Let me automatically handle the tedious task of comparing and reproducing dull design drafts! Export UI-consistent, clean, and tidy frontend code with just one click, allowing frontend engineers to focus on dynamic design and business logic development.


The project is currently in development, and many features may not be stable. If you encounter any bugs or have something to tell us, feel free to leave a message in the GitHub issue. Yes, the code is also there, it's open source.


Features


  • Export page code and static resources that match the design draft with a single click.
  • Support for automatic layout and generation of positioning styles.
  • Support for copying code of any node online.
  • Support for responsive layout units such as rem and vw.
  • Support for partial tailwindcss style conversion.
  • Support for online preview, including font styles.
  • Support for converting styles of most node types to the web environment.


Design Conventions


Converting designs accurately into code is a challenging task that often requires close collaboration between designers and developers, fully understanding the working methods and limitations of each tool.


  • Rotation is not currently supported.


Rendering Conventions


To generate more concise code, the following conventions are applied during rendering:


  • When rendering groups, only the outermost group is rendered by default if nested.
plugins.tagline: Translate designs into development-ready code at lightning speed

plugins.name: PageLocker
plugins.description:
PageLocker: Secure Your Figma Pages with Ease


PageLocker is a Figma plugin designed to give designers full control over page visibility.


üîë Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Lock Pages Securely: Hide page content while keeping it accessible to designated users with editing rights to copy files to edit.

‚Ä¢ Custom Alerts: Automatically display clear, customizable alerts for locked pages, ensuring viewers know access is restricted.

‚Ä¢ User-Friendly Interface: Simple and intuitive controls for locking, unlocking, and enabling selective access in just a few clicks.


‚öôÔ∏è How to Use:

1. Open PageLocker: Launch the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Lock Page: Securely hide all layers with one click. A customizable ‚ÄúLocked Alert‚Äù message is displayed to guide viewers.

3. Edit Design: Use the Editing Mode to duplicate layers onto a secure page, edit them freely, and then copy the updates back to the locked page. For added security, you can export the layers to a new Figma file for private editing. Alternatively, open the specific layer you want to edit in ‚Äúüîß Edit Mode.‚Äù Once finished, copy and replace it in the locked file, and then delete the ‚Äúüîß Edit Mode‚Äù file.

4. Unlock Page: Fully restore access and visibility for all users when you‚Äôre ready to share.
plugins.tagline: Securely lock pages for controlled public sharing.

  3. Select the layers you want to generate the class names for
  4. Make sure you have the Inspect panel open on the right-hand side
  5. Scroll down to the 'tailwindcss' section et voil√† ‚ú®


  1. If you don‚Äôt see this section but instead see an Inspect layer properties button, click it and you should see that section appear
  2. If you still can‚Äôt see the section, make sure you‚Äôve got `ark-tailwind-code` plugin selected from dropdown at the top-right of the `Code` section

  4. [ ] Prettier?

plugins.name: DoujinFigma
plugins.description:
# Doujin Figma - A Figma Plugin that help you make your own drawing with Stable Diffusion using Colab


Free and open source plugin for you to use Figma with Stable Diffusion.

Made this plugin for my friends so that it is easier for them to draw their Dojin Manga.

I made another Design Assistant which is called Design Wingman but it is harder to setup.

While this plugin is easier to setup.


- [x] Text to Image

- [x] Image to Image

- [x] Inpaint

- [x] Remove Background

- [ ] Segment Anything

- [x] Support Colab

- [x] Support Localhost

- [ ] Support Free to use Demo (No Localhost nor Colab needed)


## Installation

Open the following Colab Notebook

[Google Research fast-stable-diffusion]

(https://colab.research.google.com/github/TheLastBen/fast-stable-diffusion/blob/main/fast_stable_diffusion_AUTOMATIC1111.ipynb)

Follow the instruction and run all the cells.

Copy the generated URL at the very end of the Notebook and paste it onto the URL box on the very top of this plugin (Left side is URL, Right side is API keys).

For faster generate speed, it is recommended to use Stable Diffusion Turbo.

When you see the warning about Figma Extension, install the following plugin to your Stable Diffusion WebUi for full features if you want.

[DoujinFigma-AUTOMATIC1111-Extension](https://github.com/zeuscsc/DoujinFigma-AUTOMATIC1111-Extension.git)

Enjoy!

Shing Chung Z. Chiu
plugins.tagline: Free and open source plugin Figma to use Stable Diffusion to make Dojin Manga or Design Image.
